properties.areaDesc: Tompkins; Cortland; Tioga; Otsego; Broome; Chenango; Delaware
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 20 at 1:17PM EST by NWS Binghamton NY
properties.description:
At 117 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from near Oxford to near Marathon to Newfield. Movement was
south at 15 mph.

Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this dangerous squall.

This dangerous squall will be near...
Oxford around 125 PM EST.
South Oxford around 130 PM EST.
Guilford around 135 PM EST.
Lisle and Mt Upton around 140 PM EST.
Berkshire and Rockdale around 145 PM EST.
Coventry and Whitney Point around 150 PM EST.
Nanticoke and Willseyville around 155 PM EST.
Sidney and Bainbridge around 200 PM EST.

Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter of a mile in
this dangerous squall.

Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this dangerous
snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads
are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the
squall passes your location.

Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be
prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra
time when traveling.

NWSheadline: A DANGEROUS SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHWESTERN OTSEGO... NORTHWESTERN BROOME...WESTERN DELAWARE...SOUTHERN CORTLAND...CENTRAL TIOGA...SOUTHERN TOMPKINS AND SOUTHERN CHENANGO COUNTIES
